algorithm_technique: In-order traversal (or pre-order/post-order) to collect leaf node values and compare sequences.
problem_summary_simple: Check if two binary trees have the same sequence of leaf node values.
problem_summary_technical: Perform DFS on both trees to collect leaf sequences and compare them for equality.
key_insights: The core idea is to extract the leaf node sequences from both trees.
A Depth First Search (DFS) is a natural way to traverse the tree and find leaves.
Using generators or iterators can be memory-efficient for large trees, avoiding storing full lists.
